meanings.definition: Of or relating to physical symptoms caused by mental or emotional factors.
meanings.sent1: Her psychosomatic symptoms disappeared once she addressed her stress levels.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that her headaches were psychosomatic, stemming from anxiety.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his psychosomatic back pain only acted up when he had to do chores.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in her mind created a psychosomatic storm in her body.
meanings.sent5: The idea of failing the test was so terrifying that it triggered psychosomatic reactions in her stomach.

meanings.definition: A physical illness or condition that is caused or aggravated by mental or emotional factors.
meanings.sent1: The therapist helped her understand that her stomach issues were psychosomatic.
meanings.sent2: He was diagnosed with a psychosomatic disorder after experiencing unexplained pain.
meanings.sent3: The idea that his sneezing was psychosomatic made him laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of public speaking manifested as a psychosomatic hurdle to overcome.
meanings.sent5: The weight of his guilt turned into a heavy psychosomatic burden on his shoulders.
